The Linq Hotel and Casino
7.9 Very good
Based on 268 reviews

Linq Hotel felt really new due to the revamps (from what I had read) and new concepts. The hotel felt really updated and suitable for young couples.

It is located right on The Strip, opposite Caesar's Palace. Even though the lift was located far away from our room, we were alright with it as we had a huge room. I'm not sure if we had been upgraded as we booked a basic suite, however we had 2 connecting rooms - one with a kitchen/lounge area and the other with the bed. My experience was better than I had expected and I did not feel shortchanged like in some reviews that I had read.

Show more
ysabel , Singapore
Caesars Palace Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 623 reviews

The stay was okay, but when it came to checking out and trying to be on time for my ride to the airport.

.. all hell broke loose. Packed all my things up and walked to the elevator near my room... on the eleventh floor... to find out the elevator is broken. I have about 20 minutes to make it downstairs and checkout and catch my ride. Pushing the down button doesn't work, try holding it down, elevator pips up... then it stops working and starts this horrible buzzing sound. I go to the phone and explain to them what's occuring, they transfer me, and I wait on the phone for 15 minutes! By now, there are two other people with me waiting for some help. We were lucky to get some help from a house cleaner, however it was hard to communicate to her our issue since her English was broken. In the end she was amazing and showed us the location of other elevators. There are no maps to show the location of other elevators, and if it wasn't for the housemaid, we would have had to walk down stairs with all our luggage (we were all on business) and try the elevator of the floor below us. As much as I paid... I can't believe the treatment we were given. Told the front desk and all they said was, "We've heard," in a dismissive tone of voice. So rude! I enjoyed the Excalibur more than this place... Sad.

Show more
Rachel , United States
Trump International Hotel Las Vegas
8.6 Excellent
Based on 726 reviews

Very good. Check-in and check out was pleasant and stress free. All staff were excellent apart from one waiter at breakfast who virtually ignored us after we asked to order off the special August summer promotion menu.

We didn't order breakfast again after that but we did order room service every day and the room service staff were excellent. The hotel shuttle was convenient and easy to use for the strip, and the mall opposite the hotel offered a better quality shopping experience. We were pleased that the hotel wasn't overrun with slot machines and gamblers, the only criticism we had is that we had the inconvenience of having to go to other hotels for tours / rental car pick ups as it would appear that no agreement is in place with the Trump Hotel for this kind of thing.

Show more
Andrew , United Kingdom
Alexis Park All Suite Resort
7.5 Very good
Based on 187 reviews

It was a nice room for only $76. We had two double beds and a separate living room and kitchenette. Probably would have been about $200 in LA.

The only complaints I have are check in was at 4 pm. That's really late. 2-3 I understand but 4 is halfway through the day. I barely had time to shower before dinner. Also, someone should have shown us how to get to our room. They are outdoor units so it's a bit more confusing then the standard hotel. Also they don't allow you to book the hotel you want, be it a king or double or single. It's first come first serve. I thought that was quite odd. I was on vacation with my dad, what if we got stuck with a one bed room? Even though we booked it months in advance. It looked kind of like it was older and less nice and they painted and got new furniture. All in all it was average. Good price.

Show more
Kevin , United States
Best Western Plus Henderson Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 66 reviews

Overall this is a very nice hotel and a good value for the money. The biggest problem in my opinion is the smoke in the hallways.

The other comments that I have seen on the web about smoke smells in the hallways are well justified. The problem is that the windows in the rooms do not open. Therefore when people smoke in the smoking rooms the smoke is trapped in building. Smokers cannot open their windows to let their smoke out even if they wanted to, so the smoke stays in the room and goes into the halls. The non-smoking rooms stay smoke-free for the most part but when you go into your room the smoke goes in with you. I very seldom see hotel rooms (other than highrise buildings) with sealed windows. A big design mistake if you ask me. Other than this the hotel is very nice, well kept and a good value.

Show more
spero , United States
Oasis at Gold Spike
6.5 Good
Based on 25 reviews

It was first an expensive reservation. We booked last minute on a weekend during a grand opening of another casino, etc.

It was about 10% less money per night. It was because of this lower rate, that I chose the Oasis at the Gold Spike. The pool was empty. It was nice in that it had dual waterfalls and looked clean and blue. The pool was empty because the staff had turned up the music so loud that the speakers were distorting and could be heard easily from the parking lot and probably as much as few blocks away. I'm a rocker. I even LIKED the music they were playing, a local Las Vegas rock radio show. But dude, it was so amazingly loud that it was RUINING the owner's speakers. It was just so silly that NO ONE would want to go to the pool, no one. Not me, not those guys over there. NO ONE. Silly because the pool actually looked very nice, but during the two nights we were there, NO ONE used the pool. Management: get a clue. Control your staff. This isn't a night-club rave. The room was sparsely decorated with new paint, a nice color scheme, and a nice LCD TV. The room was lacking floor mats, wash cloths, and some of the blinds were bent or missing. The air conditioner was loud. The toilet got plugged up from normal use. There was hair in the tub. The phone didn't work. We asked to be moved to another room for our second night and found the beds to be much better. Our first room had rock-hard beds that were downright uncomfortable! Still missing basic amenities like soap and towels. The little restaurant inside the Oasis is very good and we went back 2x

Show more
Kathleen , United States
The Mardi Gras Hotel and Casino
6.5 Good
Based on 200 reviews

This is clearly a converted motor lodge, not at all unlike others in its class. It shows its age pretty obviously, both inside and out.

That said, it offers great value for the money. ROOM: (Single Queen) - This was a non-smoking room, and I didn't notice any odor of stale cigarettes. The room itself was large, with a comfortable queen-sized bed and a smaller couch. There was a kind of wet bar with a fridge and sink - but only one stool? The positioning of the TV was strange, as it really couldn't be seen when lounging on the bed. There was good water pressure in the shower (a big plus). It was positioned on the "outside" of the property, so there was some noise of cars/people entering and leaving... STAFF: The staff was friendly and attentive for the most part. There were those occasional moments where they were too busy talking with each other to notice that a guest needed some attention, but that happens everywhere these days. CONVENIENCE: The location is great, a 10-15 minute walk to the strip, a few minutes to the monorail, and there is a bus stop right across the street. That came in handy, as the free shuttle bus (the one that takes guests to the airport and strip) was disabled. FOOD/DRINK: I never saw anyone in the restaurant, and the bar was sparsely populated. The advertized "Specials" weren't very special at all... I will stay here again, if the price is right.

Show more
michael , United States
Thunderbird Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 45 reviews

We were received emphatically by the staff as we had a reservation from Agoda.com. The rooms requested were all available, until I was informed that the room given to me was already issued to another guest, after we had placed our belongings in the room and have used the bathroom.

As we had no choice but to vacate the room, the recourse becomes interesting. The receptionist apologetically informed me that there are no more rooms available on the ground level. They have rooms on the second floor. I was assured that there are elevators that would provide ease of access to the room at the second floor. That did not last long as I headed to the room number given to me, there were no elevators in that building. However, the receptionist was amused with my statement as she was certain that there is an elevator. As I insisted to the contrary, the receptionist directed a hotel staff to accompany to the room. When we were half way through the pathway, the staff radioed the receptionist to confirm that the room given to me is not service by an elevator.. As I have been to and from the reception area and the rooms, as I was finding the situation amusing. The Manager was there and was apologetic. To my gladness, the receptionist offered a recompense with a room tight next to the elevator however located at the third floor. I have no choice but to accept as we were tired from the long drive from L.A. And boom, the elevator was not working. Receptionist had to call their resident maintenance person to see what's the problem. So, when I saw the apologetic receptionist her excuse was "this is a very old hotel" you know.. I must say that since we survived our two day stay, we "one lucky bunch". Everything else was good! The elevator was our disappointment..

Show more
Enrique , United States
Luxury Suites International at The Signature
8.8 Excellent
Based on 31 reviews

Great location with bonus of being non smoking and non gaming. For those that want to game or swim, this hotel gives free access to MGM facilities including the grand pool and lazy rivers.

Not to mention extremely friendly staff that helped us with a couple issues we had along the way.

Show more
Blake , United States
Red Roof Inn Las Vegas
7.8 Very good
Based on 97 reviews

Was not prepared for the hotel being in the airport flight line. 6:01 am my room started to shake with the rumble of flights.

And it continued till well after midnight. I thought I could handle it. I was wrong. Louder than street noise or freeway noise by a factor of 10. Also, I was expecting a lower value. But the bed was seriously harder and less stable than I thought possible. I think in today's day, you have to work hard to find a mattress that hard and uncomfortable. And the bed frame was so short that if I sat in the end of the bed to put my shoes on, the bed would tip up. I honestly poo poo the hoyty toyty people who rip hotels in reviews. I knew I was getting a 2 star hotel. But the half star between this and La Quinta is a huge jump. It was still clean, friendly staff, etc. but the airplane noise and hard, unstable beds were hard to ignore. Sorry.

Show more
Stephen , United States
Elara by Hilton Grand Vacations
8.6 Excellent
Based on 195 reviews

Stunning Apartment........above & beyond my expectations...... beautifully appointed, huge, comfortable, clean everything you could want, what more is there to say! Large kitchen, leather stools, high bench, comfortable leather lounge in front of floor to ceiling windows with the Eiffel Tower & view of the Bellagio fountains plus the lights of Las Vegas for entertainment, huge quiet bedroom king bed, full size Jacuzzi bath & day bed in front of floor to ceiling windows with same amazing view.

Large marble bathroom, great shower double vanity & enough TV’s spread through out to satisfy any TV addict. But it’s all about the position at Vegas! This hotel is attached to the Miracle Mile Shops & Planet Hollywood Casino, perfectly placed in the centre of the strip with easy walking to all the major attractions. Take the time to explore the Miracle Mile and see the indoor rainstorm, there are some beautiful shops & galleries amongst good restaurants. Happy Travels.

Show more
Virginia , Australia
Super 8 Las Vegas Boulevard Hotel
7 Very good
Based on 131 reviews

The hotel was unaware of my booking when I arrived, but honored the voucher I had printed. There were three of at the check in desk, and I asked for and got three room keys - went to dinner before checking the room and much later opened the door to find a single queen bed for a parent and to young adult children.

Went back to the front desk and they told me they were booked. Asked for a refund and was told the since I booked they couldn't do a refund, as the money had gone to third party. I will never book this way again, and I would advise anyone who reads this to ALWAYS book directly via the Hotel/Motel. Virtually all of them will meet or beat any price you find via a third party End of story - semi happy - they clerk eventually gave a room that was reserved but not yet occupied by midnight. Hope now one came and tried to get that room while I slept ....

Show more
James , United States
Siena Suites Hotel
6.7 Good
Based on 126 reviews

1. i had read the other reviews regarding the front staff and they are all wrong. they were more than helpful and totally professional.

we had needed more towels and all it took was us going to the front office and we were given more than we could ever use in 1 min. (the reason that some complained about waiting for towels is - and they could see this for themselves - is this is a huge complex of many buildings and to have someone leaving the front desk for each call, then they would be complaining about no one at the front desk. come on people, how hard is it to go to the front and get something? 2. i was not pleased that there was not one item in the kitchen (no i did not intend on cooking etc, but to have a spoon and a cup for coffee in a condo setting?) 3. the pool was not really crystal clear. knowing a bit about pools, it needs a shock treatments and better upkeep! 4. only time that we did see some unsavory people was at the 7/11 outside of the grounds. 5. yes the condo is farther from the strip however, no one would consider staying here without a car. then its 6 miles to the strip and all hotels have free parking so stay on the strip and pay 5 times the price for a room. 6. one thing i will agree on, the beds are hard as rocks. it does appear that they have put one box spring on top of another an its not really a mattress. (sorry but i would not recommend this place as it really is more like a 1.5 star at best.

Show more
Dexter , Canada
Bluegreen Vacations Club 36, Ascend Resort Collection
8 Very good
Based on 9 reviews

The Rita Suites
7.1 Very good
Based on 95 reviews

It was ok, but it could have been better if the staff and manager really understood how to take care of their customers.

The manager is dense. She doesn't know how to satisfy customers and it's the little things that make you either a low grade or average hotel or a good or great hotel. One example (there are several) is that our paper towels were placed underneath the sink and dish water dripped on it and dried (before we checked in). When I told the staff in the early morning (8:00am), she told me they will take care of it. By 3:30pm, nothing. When leaving for a friend's wedding (3:30 pm) I talked to the staff again about this unresolved, but yet a simple issue. She told me it's on the maid's sheet to take care of. The manager came out and told me the same thing as if I was a pain in the butt because the maids haven't gotten to my room yet. 3:30pm folks, for fresh paper towels. First it's unsanitary to put paper towels underneath the sink. Why not on top of the kitchen counter? She didn't know what to do or how to take care of this simple issue and she said that as though she has done all she could do. Here was the answer. How about bringing the paper towels up to my room, say within the next 10 mins after my complaint instead of waiting over 8 hours for it? The manager is dense and not ready for prime time. And the employees reflects the manager's attitude and understanding which is low. There's more little things like this, but I'm tired of writing.

Show more
Wayne , United States
The Westin Las Vegas Hotel Casino and Spa
8.2 Excellent
Based on 29 reviews

Best Western McCarran Inn
7.7 Very good
Based on 60 reviews

This is a low end budget hotel-nothing more. It is noisy (close to airport and poorly sound insulated-they provide earplugs in the rooms), they don't do auto checkout (you have to take the keys to the desk and be out of the room to check out), it is in a very poor neighborhood that appears dangerous, a staff member filled a large bucket of ice just outside our door at 5:30am-this was very noisy, the bathroom was clean but tiny, the toilet is noisy.

I will not use this hotel again and will not recommend to others. There was an toilet smell in the lobby/breakfast room We transited LAS for reasons other than those listed. I ticked casinos as this would be the only reason to ever go there

Show more
Alan , United States
Best Western Plus Las Vegas West
8 Very good
Based on 18 reviews

I arrived at Best Western LV West in a taxi with all my bags, only to be told that the was an error with my credit card and the booking was cancelled.

I had checked the day before and the booking was confirmed, no email or call from the Hotel they just cancelled it. I asked if i could book again as i had other credit cards, and the woman on reception said no they are fully booked. No apology or help to find an alternative, we arrive in a strange country with all our bags and no where to stay. This was on Friday 15th September around 6.30pm, the woman on reception was very rude, appalling customer service and because of her i would never use Best Western again. We got a taxi to another hotel, although they were also full but the nice lady looked online and called a few local hotels to see if they had availability - thats an example of good customer service and a descent human being. We did find a hotel and the credit card worked fine there was no problem with it. A phone call from Best western would have been courteous and i could have given a different card, at least an apology on arrival would have been nice but then to shout out "have a nice day" sarcastically as we walked out the door with all our cases was absolute rudeness. As for the hotel i can't comment on the rooms. Reception was clean and un welcoming, location a bit far from the strip and customer service the worst i have ever encountered.

Show more
Adriano , United Kingdom
Best Western Plus St. Rose Pkwy/Las Vegas South Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 2 reviews

Super 8 Motel Las Vegas
7.1 Very good
Based on 154 reviews

I arrived to the hotel at 4:35 pm to be told that by a frontdesk that there is no reservation in my name.

She took my passport and tried to type the name but she insisted that there is no reservation. I left specially that i have my 8 month pregnant wife with me and reserved at another hotel and called AGODA for this problem. After around 4 hours they found my name and charged me for the night knowing that they should not because of their ignorance. Lesson Learned....

Show more
John , Lebanon
Comfort Inn & Suites
8.2 Excellent
Based on 5 reviews

Platinum Hotel and Spa
8 Very good
Based on 41 reviews

The Platinum is a solid option for those looking for a large room which is a little less pricey than the hotels right on the strip.

It's located just behind Bally's, and you can be at the Bally's sports book in a 5 minute walk. Also located in a triangle with and a 15-20 min walk from the Hard Rock and MGM. There's no casino at the Platinum, but the strip more than has you covered; also Ellis Island Casino and Brewery next door has $3 minimum bet tables and is a great place to warm up before hitting the bigger casinos. The rooms are moderately clean, not great not bad, and we stayed in a one bedroom suite which was very large and had a great view of the strip from behind.

Show more
William , United States
Best Western Plus Casino Royale
8.1 Excellent
Based on 22 reviews

Artisan-Adult Only-Boutique Hotel
6.5 Good
Based on 74 reviews

The Artisan is a lovely little Travelodge-turned-boutique-hotel located right off of West Sahara Avenue.

Though you can definitely tell it used to be a budget inn, they've redone the place quite nicely. You drive up to the front door through black-and-white striped awnings that look an awful lot like the Rumor boutique hotel -- surprise, surprise, the two hotels have the same owner. The parking around the hotel is for valet only, and there's a not-so-attractive dirt lot across the street that serves as a self-park lot. Luckily the valets are rather accommodating, and allow you to leave your car in front of the hotel while you unpack. The hotel is extremely quiet and empty during the day. From about 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., there are barely any guests -- you'd think you were the only ones staying there. The lobby is dark -- very, very dark...perhaps too dark -- and filled with old-world decor, a large fountain, and pictures and mirrors adorning every inch of wall and ceiling space. This may be the newness of the hotel, but the staff is very accommodating. The elevator requires a room key to get to your floor, probably because the hotel turns into a mini-club at night. The rooms are decently large, each themed with an artist, and funkily decorated with mirrors and pictures on the walls and ceiling. The bathroom is all black, and though the sink is a pedestal sink with no counter space, the owners have put in a shelf or two where you can place your toiletries. The shower is pretty budget-hotel-style, but they've replaced the head with a rain-shower head, and water pressure is rather good. Hot water is also excellent (not that you need it in the desert), and is almost too hot. Now, for the whole "turning into a club at night" aspect. If you're a light sleeper and you like to sleep at night, this is probably not the hotel for you. The downstairs becomes a club at night, and you can feel the bass all the way up to the top floor.

On the downside, the lines to check in and out are long — expect it to take half an hour. Also, if you’re in the pyramid section, some of the cigarette smoke from the casino floor can be smelled even inside the room. I’m usually the one who complains about cigarette smoke, but at this lower level, it was my friend who was more bothered. But we would definitely go back to the Luxor.

The manager told me that all hotels have this issue with bugs due to the heat and I just laughed because I never had this problem ever at any other time I stayed in Vegas this was like he was trying to shut me up with a bull you know what line bad come back if I might say need more training explaining things to guest .

claudia , United States
Eastside Cannery Casino Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 643 reviews

Rooms were large and pretty decent. Normally I'm a Starwood & Marriott guy. Location is away from the strip east side and the service is just ok.

At upon checkout, I called the front desk for a copy of a receipt for my business expense reimbursement, but the front desk rep was a bit rude and had a bad attitude. She said she couldn't do it since it was on Agoda. I explained to her that the Agoda receipt is not acceptable for my Company and needed a receipt with a Company letterhead. She was very unhelpful and had no idea about what customer service is. I can go elsewhere based on the level of customer service - especially in Las Vegas!

Show more
Marc , United States
The Mirage Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 423 reviews

Amazing. Everything can be done online from check-in to check-out. All you need is to pick the keys and you are good to go.

Everything about the Mirage is Grand and just about waiting to explode (much like the Volcano that goes off every evening from 7 PM every half hour... which is super sight to watch and crowd around) Location is another super-plus. You have the Treasure Island next door in case you want to catch the first Cirque du Soleil (Mystere) to start off your Vegas experience but you can always catch the Beatles in Mirage itself and that is an experience that cannot be missed as well. The Bellagio fountains are a few minutes walk away and The Venetian lies opposite to Mirage. With all this, your Vegas experience cannot be better. Swimming pool is another peaceful retreat in the Mirage wherein you can lie the whole day if you feel like and still want more. You can take a shower in the artificial waterfall as well if you are in the mood for it. 1-OAK is THE CLUB. Mirage guests are given entry without any questions and the entry is reduced charge before 12 AM and after that there is full charge. But the Club and its atmosphere is electrifying. Finally, the rooms. The beds are so comfortable that you will just sink in and doze off. You enter the rooms and luxury laps you up. Our view from the room was also to kill for. Please take higher floors for this pleasure as well. All in all - Super experience.

Show more
Basant , India
The D Las Vegas
8.1 Excellent
Based on 300 reviews

I stayed here for business and had to extend. They were very accommodating. I had a lot of inventory with me and the bellmen were great.

Really, I liked the staff. I travel 300+ days a year and for business ... this worked out. For the party crowd --- it is a younger group of people. Go go girls dancing. House music. Drinks flowing. Machines ringing. I would say that most likely 80% of them think The D stands for something other than it is ... The owner is from Detroit. Upstairs on the 2nd floor have the old school slots. Yep. Put the coins in and cash them out. There is a horse racing game that gets a fun crowd going. Quarter bet. Older crowd. Music a little more subdued. 80's stuff ...90's? Even Tom Jones singing "It's Not Unusual" and I'm only serious!! I was in the middle of 197 free spins when it was playing. Yes, a captured moment. lol :) The D Grill has Oxtail Soup. Get it. The Buffalo machines at the end of the long bar --- bang! Seriously. Keith at The D Grill (employee for 20+ years) knows Las Vegas. Ask him anything. One more thing ... the "Longbar" . . . standard fare - video games .. free drinks ... super long bar. As a guest, you can reserve seats at the bar for football games and they will televise the game that you want to watch right in front of you. You WILL want to do this. Trust me. That looooongbar is filled and has the best seating in the house. You know what? I fricken forgot to reserve seats and on game day -- it was "on and crackin" as the kids say. lol. Bottom line - great place for a great value.

Eric , United States
Hooters Casino Hotel
6.8 Good
Based on 725 reviews

I booked this on Travelworm which I've used for a long time usually they are pretty good about up-front resort fee information.

With this booking it did not say anything and I was hit with an $11 per night resort fee. They all charge this ridiculous fee now and you have to be careful when you book as sometimes the "resort fee" is more then the room rate ie...Ceasar's and the "D" & "Golden Gate". Hooter's is okay. The room was sub-standard compared to most. Haven't seen a 25" Zenith box tv in a while. There were stains on the walls of the room and the room, though non-smoking had the distinct odor of marijuana every time I opened the door. The casino is modest and I only played a little video poker. The poker machines are pretty generic compared to most on the strip or at Boyd properties. Hooters on a Wed-Thurs was pretty casual and not crowded. I didn't eat there so I can't rate the dining. I would stay there again if the room rate was cheap. I paid $21 a night plus $11 resort fee.

Paul , United States
Monte Carlo Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 674 reviews

Our stay was less than impressive at the Monte Carlo. We ordered and paid for a room with a King bed but when we checked in they told us that there were no kings available.

Ok, we are fine with that so we agree to a Queen. The first room they sent us to had the odor of smoke so bad that you could smell it in the hall before you opened the door and this is supposedly a non smoking hotel (in the rooms). The staff quickly assigned a different room and when we arrive to that around 5pm we discovered that the beds had not been made so another call to the front desk and sent to yet another room. This one seemed fine, clean and had a pool view so we were ok until we wanted to shower before we went out and of course the shower wouldn't turn on so we called and they sent maintenance up to fix it which they did. For all this inconvenience you would think they would offer an upgrade or some money off the nightly rate but all they offered us was a $50 voucher for any restaurant in their hotel. Very unimpressed with the rooms which unfortunately for our trip over shadowed the casino and restaurants they have which are good. We will not be staying at the Monte Carlo again anytime soon.

Jeffrey , United States
Four Queens Hotel & Casino
7.6 Very good
Based on 277 reviews

This was our first trip to Vegas. The Four Queens is located on Fremont. Fremont is downtown from the strip, where the old casinos are, but there is a grouping.

(The Four Queens when you walk out onto Fremont St has a canopy over the street for about 3 blocks, where there is a daily light show overhead and zipline. The street has no traffic, it is a walkway for people instead. (There is traffic which goes on the cross street so still need to use cross walks). 2 large stages with good bands. Nightlife, drinking (Bars on street) and shopping. Not always appropriate for small children. Police and security presence. Safe area. $3/day to park in garage. $9/day for internet. No resort fee. Clean, but older hotel. Carpet needed to be stretched in hallways. Ice not on every level. Offers food deals, food...eh, alright I guess. Stayed for 9 days. 3 nights, strong weed smell down the hall. Also stayed at the Venetian, at 4x the price for a couple of days. Both areas have their advantages, the strip and Fremont. Would stay at the Four Queens again, without hesitation. The pool was across the road, at their sister hotel...which currently didn't have rooms because they are redoing them. So the only patrons using the pool are from the Four Queens. You go across the street, into the other casino, up to the roof, show your door card and can use the pool. Pool water was cold even though over 110 degrees outside.

More about Las Vegas (NV)

Las Vegas is one of the most famous vacation destinations in the world. Sin City, as it is affectionately nicknamed, is a small universe of endless entertainment complete with hundreds of world-famous live shows, several theme parks, and some of the most extravagant hotels and casinos in the world.

Las Vegas is served by McCarran International Airport and Las Vegas Airport, located in North Las Vegas.

Of course gambling is the most prevalent activity in Vegas, but the city offers much more than that for those seeking a different sense of adventure and excitement. The city's proximity to the Grand Canyon makes it a must-see for nature enthusiasts, and most of the casinos and hotels along the famous Strip also offer spectacular live shows and exhibits for those who aren't interested in the gambling tables. Hotels on the famous Strip feature ongoing attractions such as a musical fountains and live shows, while the neon-illuminated pedestrian streets and Cirque du Soleil, dazzle people every night.

While Las Vegas is mostly synonymous with glamour and nighttime entertainment, the area is also a favorite among rugged outdoors enthusiasts. The desert is a visually stunning landscape and a great place for those interested in camping, hiking, or rock climbing at Red Rock Mountains, easily the best rock climbing experience in the country.

There’s much more to see and learn about Las Vegas, and the interactive map is a great way to continue uncovering all the important landmarks and attractions of this vibrant city.

The hotel felt really updated and suitable for young couples. It is located right on The Strip, opposite Caesar's Palace. Even though the lift was located far away from our room, we were alright with it as we had a huge room. I'm not sure if we had been upgraded as we booked a basic suite, however we had 2 connecting rooms - one with a kitchen/lounge area and the other with the bed. My experience was better than I had expected and I did not feel shortchanged like in some reviews that I had read. Show more ysabel , Singapore Caesars Palace Hotel 8.1 Excellent Based on 623 reviews The stay was okay, but when it came to checking out and trying to be on time for my ride to the airport. .. all hell broke loose. Packed all my things up and walked to the elevator near my room... on the eleventh floor... to find out the elevator is broken. I have about 20 minutes to make it downstairs and checkout and catch my ride. Pushing the down button doesn't work, try holding it down, elevator pips up... then it stops working and starts this horrible buzzing sound. I go to the phone and explain to them what's occuring, they transfer me, and I wait on the phone for 15 minutes! By now, there are two other people with me waiting for some help. We were lucky to get some help from a house cleaner, however it was hard to communicate to her our issue since her English was broken. In the end she was amazing and showed us the location of other elevators. There are no maps to show the location of other elevators, and if it wasn't for the housemaid, we would have had to walk down stairs with all our luggage (we were all on business) and try the elevator of the floor below us. As much as I paid... I can't believe the treatment we were given. Told the front desk and all they said was, "We've heard," in a dismissive tone of voice. So rude! I enjoyed the Excalibur more than this place... Sad. Show more Rachel , United States Trump International Hotel Las Vegas 8.6 Excellent Based on 726 reviews Very good. Check-in and check out was pleasant and stress free. All staff were excellent apart from one waiter at breakfast who virtually ignored us after we asked to order off the special August summer promotion menu. We didn't order breakfast again after that but we did order room service every day and the room service staff were excellent. The hotel shuttle was convenient and easy to use for the strip, and the mall opposite the hotel offered a better quality shopping experience. We were pleased that the hotel wasn't overrun with slot machines and gamblers, the only criticism we had is that we had the inconvenience of having to go to other hotels for tours / rental car pick ups as it would appear that no agreement is in place with the Trump Hotel for this kind of thing. Show more Andrew , United Kingdom Alexis Park All Suite Resort 7.5 Very good Based on 187 reviews It was a nice room for only $76. We had two double beds and a separate living room and kitchenette. Probably would have been about $200 in LA. The only complaints I have are check in was at 4 pm. That's really late. 2-3 I understand but 4 is halfway through the day. The HVAC would not go above 65 degrees even though I tried to set it several times. We could not get room service to answer the phone. The food we finally settled for - having to go down to get it because we were traveling with our dog - tasted terrible, very salty and doughy chicken wings, raw, tough steaks, greasy vegetables. My husband had to wait over 45 minutes to get the food and this was not peak foodservice time, 9:30 PM. Although the room was advertised at being $29.90 per night, the hidden fees raised the room rate to $120. I will say this - the desk clerk was friendly and courteous. Show more Luann , United States Luxor Hotel 7.4 Very good Based on 1369 reviews We really enjoyed out time at the Luxor. We stayed in the pyramid section, which is really ‘trippy’. The angled elevators are part of the thrill, as well as walking along the insides of the pyramid (don’t be surprised by a bit of vertigo). Service is good and the staff are friendly and competent. One can see that the room furniture is showing its age and there seem to be issues with the building itself, but the Luxor can be a real bargain for the main strip in Vegas. On non-peak days, it’s not much more than the ‘bargain’ motels and is certainly a lot nicer. The dinner buffet was great. We got there late and thus missed dessert — but otherwise, there was a huge selection of very good food, with a cool atmosphere, to boot (I sure hope all that extra food gets donated). On the downside, the lines to check in and out are long — expect it to take half an hour. Also, if you’re in the pyramid section, some of the cigarette smoke from the casino floor can be smelled even inside the room. I’m usually the one who complains about cigarette smoke, but at this lower level, it was my friend who was more bothered. But we would definitely go back to the Luxor. Show more Tim , United States Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino 8.2 Excellent Based on 590 reviews Since this was my first time in Vegas, I was very pleased with the location of the hotel and the hotel price was perfect. By boyfriend and I found the room to accommodations to be very nicely arraigned. I love the idea that we did not have to go out the main strip to find activities every thing was right there at our leisure from gift shops to star bucks. We just walked out the hotel door to Freemont to find night activities of costume characters, people hang-gliding over our heads as well as the awesome light show and we loved that fantastic saxophone player. There were a few other activities that were a little different for us but the main thing was that we enjoyed the stay. However, as there are the good there is also the bad. So, the bathtub does not drain properly when taking a shower unfortunately you will find yourself standing in ankle deep water. There meal for the buffet is definitely way over priced. As a guest in the hotel, you would think the buffet prices would be a little lower. I was not sure about the cover charge of $22.00 that is required when the guest first arrives. Maybe if is for the two bottles of water that are $4.00 a piece and the Kurri coffee machine that is in the room. And last but not least they truly need a few more concierge to handle the front desk the lines were pretty long for checking in and checking out ☹ Show more Deidra , United States Paris Las Vegas Hotel 8 Very good Based on 772 reviews It's been 7 years since we've stayed there and it' did not have the same appeal. Had to stand in line for a half hour just to check in. The room was nice but that's about it. Breakfast the first morning they had construction going on near us and it was so LOUD. We ended up going over to another hotel just to get away from the noise. Back there later but did not like the VIBE in the casino. They had a girl dancing on the bar. This was not a customer it was a dancer hired by the hotel. My wife and I thought that was TRASHY! We were there for 3 days and decided to leave a day early since my wife was not feeling well. That morning I go to check us out and the women behind the counter was very UNFRIENDLY. I walk up with a "good morning" and this lady just stares at me. I told her we were checking out early. Instead of saying "oh i'm sorry to hear that." she goes off that our room was pre-paid and there are no REFUNDS because were checking out early. I was not looking for a refund? But where was the customer service "Did you enjoy your stay." etc, etc. She would not give me any paper work showing that I was checking out? She said checkout would be automatic tomorrow. But I did not want to be responsible if someone was given our room and there were damages, I've heard of that happening. So we left there with nothing. We will not be returning to the Paris Hotel ever again. Show more Jerry , United States Aria Resort and Casino 8.7 Excellent Based on 630 reviews The hotel was not bad but was the only let down on our vacation. We have visited Vegas four times in the past 18 months, staying at the Encore & Cosmopoliton resorts previously. Encore & Cosmopolitan resorts were exceptional and made every second of past vacations enjoyable & set a very high standard to any resort we plan to stay at in the future wherever we go in the world. For out trip to Vegas in December 2015 we decided to stay at Aria resort for a change.. Upon arrival no one assisted us out of the taxi, no one greeted us with the usual "Welcome to Aria sir." ..Nothing!! Upon walking into the lobby there was a large que for check in with just three out of the many desks being operated from. Once checked in we walked to the room and the distance from the lift felt was like as if it was a miles away! It irritated us that much that on one ocassion we timed walking from the lift on our floor to the door of room, it took well over 2 minutes!! We can appreciate this is no ones fault and the hotel plan is big but maybe suggest more elevators around the resort??! The room was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable! The first night, the light switch surround fell off next to the bed, the bathroom had an bad odour for the entire stay, the shower had a leak from the shower housing (did not bother us, but not a good impression for this sort of resort) The remote control for TV only worked from one point of the room which was annoying when lying in bed. However the room cleaning services were great! The main issue we had was a fixed $29 per day resort fee we were unaware of upon check out, The lady on the desk struggled with questions about the fee and told me "I booked & paid for the room only & not the facilities of the resort I.e swimming pools" which we didn't use any of anyway. When leaving with our cases a bell boy was at the exit doors we approached & didn't assist to open the door when we acknowledged each other and watched us struggle Left with a bad taste Show more Bradley , United Kingdom MGM Grand Hotel and Casino 7.9 Very good Based on 1216 reviews We went over labour weekend in Sept, possibly one of the busiest weekends of the year. Theres lots of pools to chose from and people offering you guest list entry to clubs which was handy as there were big name DJS in town. Is at the top end of the strip so easy enough to walk down about $10 in taxi to Ceasars. Choice of restaurants is great, quality of beds and rooms very good. (Being able to eat a steak or pancakes in Wolfgang Puck after a night out was cool!) The nightclubs and bars were also good. I have been to Vegas 3 times, would happily stay here again. Only down side was i didn't have an amazing view so paid for upgrade to a better view. Show more Sarah , United Kingdom Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino 8 Very good Based on 545 reviews The room had the worst view I've ever had at a hotel. We were facing the roof of a building that looked like a factory with nothing else in sight. When we asked for a better view they told us it would be an extra $100/night. The room itself was nothing like the pictures online. It looked like a semi nice motel room. The first night we were there my husband wanted to take a bath and the bath plug didn't work right and then it look forever to drain the water. The toilet was practically non functional. You could put one piece of toilet paper in the toilet and you would need to flush is 3 times before it went down. The next morning my husband wanted to take a shower and there was NO hot water. The water was room temperature and the shower head was like a broken sprinkler. 0 pressure. We called and complained after the no hot water and the manager Vicky offered to send someone to check on it and my husband refused because he's a plumber and knew that it's not something that can be fixed right away. The shower head would need to be changed and the no hot water couldn't be fixed because the water heater wasn't working properly (my husbands diagnosis). Vicky offered another room but not nicely and with no apologizes. I told her we paid $400 for the room and it wasn't free because I was irritated at how non chalant the staff was being about our concerns even while offering another room. We didn't take the other room they offered because we had already unpacked a lot of stuff and hung all our clothes and didn't want to waste our last day packing and moving just to be disappointed with a room that was the same as the one we had. They never mentioned an upgrade or anything for us to think the room they were moving us too was better. This was our first and last time staying at planet hollywood. It definitely wasn't a good start to our new year. Luckily we had family staying at Cosmo which is where we had fun and gambled A LOT. Show more Raffi , United States Tuscany Suites and Casino Hotel 8.3 Excellent Based on 466 reviews The 3-floor suites allow you to have a quiet stay and more privacy. You may hear birds chirping in the morning! The bushes and trees really do make it homey. Some things I did not like about this hotel: - The Resort Fee did not help. I did not use wifi, neither the gym facilities, nor the pool. This is one fee that is a cash grab which offers no added value whatsoever. This fee should be optional if one intends to use the wifi, gym and pool... - The entrance to my building (L) was extremely poor. One has to make a 5 meter detour around the front entrance of the building because a hedge blocks the path with a steep gravel hill in front of the hedge leading to the road. In order to get to the entrance, one has to go around this hedge to a ramp around the side of the building. This is inefficient when bringing luggage to the door. - Some of the staff were stressed and not super friendly. Most of the staff were courteous though. - One should be given the option whether one wants the wifi router to be shut off completely or shut off at certain times when going to sleep. It is not healthy to have wifi exposing people to carcinogenic radiowaves. Therefore, I suggest that Tuscany Suites implement what I mentioned above and offer its customers a hard-wired ethernet connection such as that avail. at another hotel nearby. - There is also a cell tower on the west side of the hotel. The tower is located on the property of another hotel near the fence bordering Tuscany Suites.everyone within an 800 M radius is therefore being irradiated at high levels. Assuming this tower is not on Tuscany's property, this is not Tuscany's fault but is something to take into consideration. Show more Max , Canada South Point Hotel Casino and Spa 8.2 Excellent Based on 446 reviews I would love to agree with the overall great reviews of this place, but the uncaring and rolling-eyes-at-me attitude of the front desk person, that person's boss, and that person's boss when I tried to get the (extortionary) "resort fee" waived was unacceptable. I didn't need their shuttle to the airport, their boarding pass printing, or their damn free local calls, or their (spotty) wi-fi. I was checked in for about 16 hours, from Saturday evening to Sunday morning, and went out to see friends at night, so I wasn't in the room much - so the use of the pool and the fitness room was another non-starter for me. I tried to talk to the people about having to pay this fee - which I understand is common Vegas rip-off behavior - but they insisted there was no way around it. I told the third lady to whom I spoke that I would never be coming back there (despite the admittedly comfortable bed) and she said "Good for you, sir," The point of the story is that resort fees are a bunch of crap. I know it, they know it, and they know they've got you. I don't appreciate their smug attitude and I wonder what sort of tomfoolery the greedy at the South Point (and, admittedly, almost all other Vegas hotels) are going to come up with next. But again - the beds were very comfy. Oh, and the stuff in the little store was reasonable priced. My wife and I got two little things of milk and two ice cream sandwiches for $5. So there's that. Still... Show more Ben , United States Harrah's Las Vegas Hotel 7.6 Very good Based on 520 reviews It was good value for money and the location was good however the place reeked of smokers. The smell was everywhere and because of this I found the casino floor particularly gross. Furthermore it was difficult to breathe. It was a nightmare every time we had to go through the casino (the layout of the venue forces you to go through this every time you leave/return) to make it back to our room. When I first arrived I was approached by one of their staff behind a counter in the lobby who wanted to offer a welcome gift. The 'gift' turned out to be a gift with a catch, with the condition being that you accept a visit and sell by Wyndam Resorts in return for some free show or tour tickets. Soon realising the scheme (I was conscious of what was up) I declined the offer. He asked why and I advised that I knew how the scheme works and explained further. His face just suddenly changed from extremely friendly to "get the hell out of here!". The act was rather plastic. The room itself was fine and the housekeepers were friendly. Show more LIM , Australia Westgate Las Vegas Resort & Casino 7.3 Very good Based on 716 reviews The Westgate is located off the main strip. The rooms are a good size, we had a seating area and king bed. The pool area is great, large pool and plenty of sun loungers. To get to the main strip you can either use the monorail (station at the hotel) $12 for a day ticket of the SDX bus, $8 for a day ticket. The bus top is a 5 minute walk from the hotel entrance on Paradise road. You can catch the bus to the strip or to the Fremont experience. The bus runs approx. every 15 minutes. The price we paid was extremely good value for the room (AUS $55), but if you use the coffee or water bottles in the room you will be charged extra. We didn't have to pay the resort fee, it seemed to be an additional extra, not compulsory like the other hotels. The only negative about the hotel is the sound proofing between the rooms. You can hear people talking in adjoining rooms and if you have a room next to a lift you will hear the lift being used. Overall very good value for money. Show more Andrew , Australia Excalibur Hotel 7.5 Very good Based on 1552 reviews When we first got to the hotel my kids were so happy to see the night life with an rollercoaster ride from our room window, then when the talbles turned my daughter came running out of the bathroom saying Daddy a bug is on the mirror so I went in and killed it but didn't feel clean about staying in this room so I called down to the front desk to explain what was in the room so the manager changed our room to a room that they call an upgrade which looked like the same room in a different floor no refrigerator, microwave. The manager explain to me that she will take off $37 for fees of parking, hotel for the first night but then my kids went to the window of the supposed to be an upgrade had a view of the parking lot nothing they were happy about so I called the desk to explain we got not what we had before because we were there for the kids pleasure so they was willing to change us the rooms for us the next day because they had no more rooms available with that view the kids enjoyed so we would have to wait till the next day to move again. This was the most unsatisfied stay at an hotel in Vegas by far we will never stay here again and to add to this I contacted the desk again to explain that this is not a supposed to be a vacation stay turned into a working room moving the whole stay here I think they should have done better by compensating us for moving around room to room . The manager told me that all hotels have this issue with bugs due to the heat and I just laughed because I never had this problem ever at any other time I stayed in Vegas this was like he was trying to shut me up with a bull you know what line bad come back if I might say need more training explaining things to guest . Show more claudia , United States Eastside Cannery Casino Hotel 8.1 Excellent Based on 643 reviews Rooms were large and pretty decent. Normally I'm a Starwood & Marriott guy. Location is away from the strip east side and the service is just ok. At upon checkout, I called the front desk for a copy of a receipt for my business expense reimbursement, but the front desk rep was a bit rude and had a bad attitude. She said she couldn't do it since it was on Agoda. I explained to her that the Agoda receipt is not acceptable for my Company and needed a receipt with a Company letterhead. She was very unhelpful and had no idea about what customer service is. I can go elsewhere based on the level of customer service - especially in Las Vegas! Show more Marc , United States The Mirage Hotel 8.2 Excellent Based on 423 reviews Amazing. Everything can be done online from check-in to check-out. All you need is to pick the keys and you are good to go. Everything about the Mirage is Grand and just about waiting to explode (much like the Volcano that goes off every evening from 7 PM every half hour... which is super sight to watch and crowd around) Location is another super-plus. You have the Treasure Island next door in case you want to catch the first Cirque du Soleil (Mystere) to start off your Vegas experience but you can always catch the Beatles in Mirage itself and that is an experience that cannot be missed as well. The Bellagio fountains are a few minutes walk away and The Venetian lies opposite to Mirage. With all this, your Vegas experience cannot be better. Swimming pool is another peaceful retreat in the Mirage wherein you can lie the whole day if you feel like and still want more. You can take a shower in the artificial waterfall as well if you are in the mood for it. 1-OAK is THE CLUB. Mirage guests are given entry without any questions and the entry is reduced charge before 12 AM and after that there is full charge. But the Club and its atmosphere is electrifying. Finally, the rooms. The beds are so comfortable that you will just sink in and doze off. You enter the rooms and luxury laps you up. Our view from the room was also to kill for. Please take higher floors for this pleasure as well. All in all - Super experience. Show more Basant , India The D Las Vegas 8.1 Excellent Based on 300 reviews I stayed here for business and had to extend. They were very accommodating. I had a lot of inventory with me and the bellmen were great. Really, I liked the staff. I travel 300+ days a year and for business ... this worked out. For the party crowd --- it is a younger group of people. Go go girls dancing. House music. Drinks flowing. Machines ringing. I would say that most likely 80% of them think The D stands for something other than it is ... The owner is from Detroit. Upstairs on the 2nd floor have the old school slots. Yep. Put the coins in and cash them out. There is a horse racing game that gets a fun crowd going. Quarter bet. Older crowd. Music a little more subdued. 80's stuff ...90's? Even Tom Jones singing "It's Not Unusual" and I'm only serious!! I was in the middle of 197 free spins when it was playing. Yes, a captured moment. lol :) The D Grill has Oxtail Soup. Get it. The Buffalo machines at the end of the long bar --- bang! Seriously. Keith at The D Grill (employee for 20+ years) knows Las Vegas. Ask him anything. One more thing ... the "Longbar" . . . standard fare - video games .. free drinks ... super long bar. As a guest, you can reserve seats at the bar for football games and they will televise the game that you want to watch right in front of you. You WILL want to do this. Trust me. That looooongbar is filled and has the best seating in the house. You know what? I fricken forgot to reserve seats and on game day -- it was "on and crackin" as the kids say. lol. Bottom line - great place for a great value. Show more Eric , United States Hooters Casino Hotel 6.8 Good Based on 725 reviews I booked this on Travelworm which I've used for a long time usually they are pretty good about up-front resort fee information. With this booking it did not say anything and I was hit with an $11 per night resort fee. They all charge this ridiculous fee now and you have to be careful when you book as sometimes the "resort fee" is more then the room rate ie...Ceasar's and the "D" & "Golden Gate". Hooter's is okay. The room was sub-standard compared to most. Haven't seen a 25" Zenith box tv in a while. There were stains on the walls of the room and the room, though non-smoking had the distinct odor of marijuana every time I opened the door. The casino is modest and I only played a little video poker. The poker machines are pretty generic compared to most on the strip or at Boyd properties. Hooters on a Wed-Thurs was pretty casual and not crowded. I didn't eat there so I can't rate the dining. I would stay there again if the room rate was cheap. I paid $21 a night plus $11 resort fee. Show more Paul , United States Monte Carlo Hotel 7.7 Very good Based on 674 reviews Our stay was less than impressive at the Monte Carlo. We ordered and paid for a room with a King bed but when we checked in they told us that there were no kings available. Ok, we are fine with that so we agree to a Queen. The first room they sent us to had the odor of smoke so bad that you could smell it in the hall before you opened the door and this is supposedly a non smoking hotel (in the rooms). The staff quickly assigned a different room and when we arrive to that around 5pm we discovered that the beds had not been made so another call to the front desk and sent to yet another room. This one seemed fine, clean and had a pool view so we were ok until we wanted to shower before we went out and of course the shower wouldn't turn on so we called and they sent maintenance up to fix it which they did. For all this inconvenience you would think they would offer an upgrade or some money off the nightly rate but all they offered us was a $50 voucher for any restaurant in their hotel. Very unimpressed with the rooms which unfortunately for our trip over shadowed the casino and restaurants they have which are good. We will not be staying at the Monte Carlo again anytime soon. Show more Jeffrey , United States Four Queens Hotel & Casino 7.6 Very good Based on 277 reviews This was our first trip to Vegas. The Four Queens is located on Fremont. Fremont is downtown from the strip, where the old casinos are, but there is a grouping. (The Four Queens when you walk out onto Fremont St has a canopy over the street for about 3 blocks, where there is a daily light show overhead and zipline. The street has no traffic, it is a walkway for people instead. (There is traffic which goes on the cross street so still need to use cross walks). 2 large stages with good bands. Nightlife, drinking (Bars on street) and shopping. Not always appropriate for small children. Police and security presence. Safe area. $3/day to park in garage. $9/day for internet. No resort fee. Clean, but older hotel. Carpet needed to be stretched in hallways. Ice not on every level. Offers food deals, food...eh, alright I guess. Stayed for 9 days. 3 nights, strong weed smell down the hall. Also stayed at the Venetian, at 4x the price for a couple of days. Both areas have their advantages, the strip and Fremont. Would stay at the Four Queens again, without hesitation. The pool was across the road, at their sister hotel...which currently didn't have rooms because they are redoing them. So the only patrons using the pool are from the Four Queens. You go across the street, into the other casino, up to the roof, show your door card and can use the pool. Pool water was cold even though over 110 degrees outside. Vegas 54 hotels South of The Strip 44 hotels Lake Las Vegas 24 hotels Boulder City 8 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Resorts in Las Vegas (NV) 90 Motels in Las Vegas (NV) 35 More about Las Vegas (NV) Las Vegas is one of the most famous vacation destinations in the world. Sin City, as it is affectionately nicknamed, is a small universe of endless entertainment complete with hundreds of world-famous live shows, several theme parks, and some of the most extravagant hotels and casinos in the world. Las Vegas is served by McCarran International Airport and Las Vegas Airport, located in North Las Vegas. Of course gambling is the most prevalent activity in Vegas, but the city offers much more than that for those seeking a different sense of adventure and excitement. The city's proximity to the Grand Canyon makes it a must-see for nature enthusiasts, and most of the casinos and hotels along the famous Strip also offer spectacular live shows and exhibits for those who aren't interested in the gambling tables. Hotels on the famous Strip feature ongoing attractions such as a musical fountains and live shows, while the neon-illuminated pedestrian streets and Cirque du Soleil , dazzle people every night. While Las Vegas is mostly synonymous with glamour and nighttime entertainment, the area is also a favorite among rugged outdoors enthusiasts. The desert is a visually stunning landscape and a great place for those interested in camping, hiking, or rock climbing at Red Rock Mountains , easily the best rock climbing experience in the country. There’s much more to see and learn about Las Vegas, and the interactive map is a great way to continue uncovering all the important landmarks and attractions of this vibrant city.
